body.header:
Read this sample answer to the writing task in the last exercise and find the mistakes. There are 15. Click on them.
Writing Task 1

section.p: The bar chart compares the size of the active membership of different religious faiths in the UK and shows increases in membership numbers between 1970 and 2000. The pie chart gives an indication of how often adults in Britain participated in religious services at 1999.

A first glance at the bar chart shows that the Christian faith has had by far the largest membership throughout the thirty years, but also that this membership declined sharp over the period. From 9.5 thousand in 1970, membership had fallen to two-thirds of that figure by 2000. Similarly, active membership of the Jewish faith fell by approximately a third during this time.

Other faiths, however, rose their membership during the three decades. The most dramatical rise was in the number of active Muslims. Membership in 2000, who rose by around two-thirds of a million, was five times as higher as it had been in 1970. The number of active Buddhists also rose fivefold during this period. Sikhs and other faiths quadrupled their active membership, while the number of active Hindus halved.

The pie chart shows the active membership of all faiths as an amount of the adult population of Britain. Only just under 1 in 10 said that they attended services on a weekly basis. Nearly half said they practically never attended religious services.

However, despite the low numbers of active membership, only a tenth of those questioned reported that they had no religion. This suggests that although the minority of adults in Britain do not attend services, they do still hold some kind of religious belief.

p.font: changes: Not all changes over the period were increases.
had: The chart does not show present situation, so present perfect is not appropriate here.
sharply: The adverb is needed here, to describe the verb 'decline'.
increased: Rise is an intransitive verb. It does not take an object.
dramatic: The correct form of the adjective is 'dramatic'.
which: The pronoun refers to the word 'membership', not to individuals.
high: The structure is 'as + adjective + as'. The comparative form is not used.
a proportion: In this case, the proportion is a percentage.
majority: 48% say that they practically never attend services, and 10% say they have no religion.
